subject: Business
title: The Jobs To Be Done Framework
description: A quick win: understand The Jobs To Be Done Framework.

hook.text: Nobody wants a quarter-inch drill. They want a quarter-inch hole. Theodore Levitt nailed it.

buildup.text: Jobs To Be Done says customers hire products to accomplish a specific job in their life.

discovery.text: A milkshake competes with bananas and boredom, not just other milkshakes. The job: make a long commute bearable.

twist.text: When you define competition by the job, your real competitors change completely â€” and so does your strategy.

climax.text: Clayton Christensen used JTBD to explain why innovations succeed or fail regardless of how good the product is.

punchline.text: Don't ask what your product does. Ask what job your customer needs done.

quiz.question: According to JTBD, what does a customer really buy?
options: A solution to a specific job they need done
The product with the most features
